intro: Psychrogeton khorossanicus, commonly known as the Khorosan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms during the summer months. Psychrogeton khorossanicus is often found in alpine environments and is adapted to cold climates.
